page.title: 09Interviews With Older People
page.content: Mrs Lawrence is 91 and her Dad worked at{Redruth tram}station.In the war she worked in an{ammunition}factory. She did not have any pocket money and she used to play mud pies.Mrs.Jenkin has lived here for 20 years .Her ancestors came from{Pool}and{Helston and worked at{S.Crofty}mine.She has seen a lot of changes like the new Bypass,closing of the{Portreath {railway, Guiness Trust houses, computers,and coloured T.V.She didn't think the old days were better.In the war she worked at the{I.C.I factory}at {Tuckingmill}until she went nursing.She did have pocket money which she spent on sweets.Mr.Griffiths has lived here for 63 years.He also worked at {I.C.I.}and was a bomber pilot in the war.His pocket money was a shilling and he had his tonsils out on the front room table.
